Description: Rim and bowl sherd of Attic black-figured pottery Siana cup; interior glazed black; exterior: lip reserved; band at top of handle zone, in which there are preserved part of two upright, incised palmettes with alternating added red and black leaves.
Curator's comments: For the palmettes on the bowl of a Siana cup, see Brijder, H. A. G., Siana Cups I and Komast Cups. Amsterdam 1983, 262 and pl. 55, no. 271 (Syracuse 6190), no. 273 (Corinth C 47-691), no. 277 (Tocra 1040). All double-deckers with double-palmette chains are by the Double-Palmette Painter.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0377) (Phase 1)
